perturbation.original_text: Payments called for by this Section 5 which are not received within five (5) business days after the date upon which payment is due will bear interest at a rate equal to the lesser of one and one-half percent (1- 1/2%) per month or the maximum legal rate permitted under the controlling Laws. Payment of such interest shall not cure or excuse any breach of any underlying payment obligation.
perturbation.changed_text: Payments called for by this Section 5 which are not received within ten (10) business days after the date upon which payment is due will bear interest at a rate equal to the lesser of one percent (1%) per month or the prime rate. Payment of such interest shall not cure or excuse any breach of any underlying payment obligation.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction by modifying the payment deadline from five business days to ten, the interest rate from 1.5% to 1%, and changing the benchmark rate from the maximum legal rate to the prime rate. This creates uncertainty regarding when late fees apply and how they are calculated, making the enforcement ambiguous.

perturbation.original_text: Without limiting the generality of the foregoing, Company will ensure that such policies contain a waiver of subrogation against ACSI, name ACSI and its assignees as additional insureds. Company will not modify or terminate any coverage without giving at least thirty (30) days' prior written notice to ACSI. Upon request from ACSI, Company will furnish to ACSI certificates of insurance and such other documentation relating to such policies as ACSI may reasonably request.
perturbation.changed_text: Without limiting the generality of the foregoing, Company will ensure that such policies contain a waiver of subrogation against ACSI, name ACSI and its assignees as additional insureds. Company may modify or terminate any coverage with written notice to ACSI but without needing ACSI's consent. Upon request from ACSI, Company is not obligated to furnish to ACSI certificates of insurance and such other documentation relating to such policies as ACSI may reasonably request.
perturbation.explanation: This change contradicts the obligations regarding insurance policies. The original text requires 30 days' notice before modification or termination of coverage and obligates the Company to furnish insurance documentation upon request. The modified text removes the obligation to maintain 30 days written notice and states that Company is not obligated to furnish ACSI with proof of requested documents. This makes enforcement of consistent insurance coverage uncertain.

perturbation.original_text: The Parties will issue a joint press release promptly upon concluding Advertising. this Agreement, which press release shall be subject to the Party's mutual approval, which shall in any event state that Company is the exclusive provider on the ACSI Site of premium spoken-word audio product for download or streaming over the world wide web. The Parties shall have the right to issue mutually agreeable additional press releases describing the nature of their relationship at such times as the Parties shall mutually agree. Neither Party will issue any other press releases, make any other disclosures regarding this Agreement or its terms or the relationship between the Parties, or use the other Party's Trademarks (except as permitted by Section 6), without the other Party's prior written consent, except that, each Party may, without the other Party's prior consent: (y) distribute or issue public relations materials or press releases that contain a description of the relationship between the Parties, provided that such description has been approved in advance by such other Party (which approval shall not be unreasonably withheld or delayed); and (z) speak in public regarding disclosures made pursuant to the first sentence of this Section 3.1 [Press Releases]. Parties will be able to include a description of this strategic partnership in the "company descriptor" section of standard releases, subject to initial mutual approvals.
perturbation.changed_text: The Parties will issue a joint press release promptly upon concluding Advertising. this Agreement, which press release shall be subject to the Party's mutual approval, which shall in any event state that Company is the preferred provider on the ACSI Site of spoken-word audio product for download or streaming over the world wide web. Either Party can independently issue additional press releases describing the nature of their relationship without mutual agreement. Either Party may issue press releases or make disclosures regarding this Agreement, using the other Party's Trademarks, with notification but without requiring prior written consent, subject to trademark usage guidelines. Parties will be able to include a description of this strategic partnership in the "company descriptor" section of standard releases, subject to initial mutual approvals.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces contradictions regarding press releases and public disclosures. The original text requires mutual approval for press releases and prevents unilateral disclosures about the agreement. The modified text allows either party to independently issue press releases and disclosures, only requiring notification instead of prior written consent. This creates ambiguity about the level of control each party has over public statements about the partnership.
